      Parameters:

    • scrollChat

      public void scrollChat(MESSAGE message, boolean Private)
      This method moves all the messages upward by one place and insert the given message in the first 'cell' of the message list. ( the messages in the scene are TextFields with unique fx-ids, so the structure of the messages is not actually a list but a series of TexFields with unique fx-ids with no relationship between each other )
      Specified by:
      scrollChat in interface GUI_commands
      Parameters:
      message -
      Private -

    • chatEnter

      public void chatEnter()
      This method takes the chat input from the player and sends it to the server, then it shows the message in the scene. The method splits the message if necessary ( default split threshold : 45 char ) and scrolls the chat.
      Specified by:
      chatEnter in interface GUI_commands

    • drawUp

      public void drawUp()
      This method switches the selected item in the draw pile with the item on top of it. (if the selected item is already on the top, the method does nothing) The method also saves the order in which the item selected must be placed in the bookshelf.
      Specified by:
      drawUp in interface GUI_commands

    • drawDown

      public void drawDown()
      This method switches the selected item in the draw pile with the item under it. (if the selected item is already on the bottom, the method does nothing) The method also saves the order in which the item selected must be placed in the bookshelf.
      Specified by:
      drawDown in interface GUI_commands

    • drawItem

      public void drawItem(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      This method updates the draw process and sends a draw request at the server. if the draw is valid or not the player is notified.
      Specified by:
      drawItem in interface GUI_commands
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - is required to get the row and column of the selected item in the SpriteBoard.

    • putItem

      public void putItem()
      This method updates the put process and sends a put request at the server. The method finds the correct order of the drawn items and sends them to the server. If the put is valid the method resets the draw attributes and the selected column of the bookshelf. If the put is not valid the player is notified.
      Specified by:
      putItem in interface GUI_commands

    • setCommonGoals

      public void setCommonGoals(List<Integer> cardID, List<Integer> token)
      Specified by:
      setCommonGoals in interface GUI_commands

    • setScore

      public void setScore(int score)
      Specified by:
      setScore in interface GUI_commands

    • replyDraw

      public boolean replyDraw()
      This method checks if a reply for a put request has been received. If the reply arrives, the value of the reply is returned, else it loops forever.
      Specified by:
      replyDraw in interface GUI_commands
      Returns:
      result of draw request.

    • replyPut

      public boolean replyPut()
      This method checks if a reply for end turn request has been sent. If the reply arrives, the value of the reply is returned, else it loops forever.
      Specified by:
      replyPut in interface GUI_commands

    • replaceClient

      public void replaceClient(ClientTCP clientTCP)
      This method allow the GUI to replace the reference to the client if the connection is lost and the reconnection protocol has started.
      Specified by:
      replaceClient in interface GUI_commands
      Parameters:
      clientTCP - is the client tcp reference.

    • replaceClient

      public void replaceClient(ClientRMI clientRMI)
      This method allow the GUI to replace the reference to the client if the connection is lost and the reconnection protocol has started.
      Specified by:
      replaceClient in interface GUI_commands
      Parameters:
      clientRMI - is the client rmi reference
